intro: Phyllanthus rangoloakensis, commonly known as the Khasi phyllanthus, is a shrub native to the northeastern regions of India. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forested areas. It has a woody stem with a rough, bark-like surface and produces small, fleshy fruits. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare species with potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
